degreeTracks.name: Bachelor of Science in Mathematics (BS Math)
degreeTracks.description: A rigorous undergraduate program providing a strong foundation in pure mathematics, preparing students for graduate studies or quantitative careers.

electiveGroups.name: Advanced Pure Mathematics Electives
electiveGroups.description: Choose 2 courses (6 credits) from advanced topics in Algebra, Analysis, Geometry, or Topology, beyond required core courses.

electiveGroups.name: Applied Mathematics & Statistics Electives
electiveGroups.description: Choose 2 courses (6 credits) from Numerical Analysis, Optimization, Probability, or Statistics.

electiveGroups.name: General Electives
electiveGroups.description: Additional 12 credits of mathematics electives at 300-level or higher.

degreeTracks.prerequisitesOverview: A strong foundation in multivariable calculus, linear algebra, and proof-based mathematics is essential. Specific prerequisites are enforced per course to ensure a logical learning progression.

capstone.description: An independent research project culminating in a written thesis and oral presentation, demonstrating advanced mathematical thinking and communication skills.

masteryExam.topics: Covers core undergraduate areas including Real Analysis, Abstract Algebra, and Topology.
masteryExam.passCriteria: Demonstration of deep conceptual understanding, advanced problem-solving abilities, and coherent explanation of foundational theories.
